class_types.description:
Embarking on a teacher training journey is an exciting and important step! Equip yourself with the information you need to make the best choice and get to know your trainers. During our info sessions, you'll learn what is unique about YYOGA's 200-hour program, as well as get the inside scoop on scheduling, pricing, and teachers.
 
**This is an online offering. You will receive an email and link from FitGrid one hour prior to access the info session.**
 
By signing up for this event you are giving your consent to receive details about this information session, including the meeting link, to the email address provided. You will also periodically receive information about Teacher Training that is relevant to you. You can unsubscribe from these emails at any time.
class_types.name: Teacher Training Info Session

instructors.bio:
I first discovered yoga in 2001, amidst my career as an RN, and it was love at first practice. This passion later blossomed into my true calling as I became certified as a yoga and Pilates teacher. To enhance my yoga practice, I further qualified as a Personal Trainer, Nutrition Coach, and specialist in Behaviour Change and Metabolic Health.

At YYOGA, I teach a variety of classes, including Pilates Fusion, Hatha, Flow, Power, YHot, and YSculpt. I blend my extensive knowledge of the human body with my expertise in health and fitness. This unique combination helps me create holistic, transformative experiences for my students, aiming to empower them physically, mentally, and spiritually. 

In my free time, I’m dedicated to bodybuilding, a discipline that challenges me and complements my yoga practice. I also cherish my role as a wife and a grandmother, enjoying every moment I spend with my two grandchildren. For me, fitness isn’t just about the physical aspect; it’s a lifestyle that enc
instructors.name: Avital Belkin

instructors.bio:
I am a passionate yoga teacher and student from the Philippines!

Love at first class – that was what I felt after a flow class that I took more than a decade ago. I was drawn to the challenge and sense of calm that the practice gave me. The desire to deepen my practice led to a teacher training in 2012 which ignited the calling to share my yoga to the community. I completed my 500-hr certification with YogaWorks in NYC and I have been teaching ever since. My inspirations and mentors are David Kim, Heather Seagraves, Bernie Clarke, Rachel Scott, and Jasmina Egeler. My passion led me to co-own a yoga studio in the Philippines and teach in New York, Saigon and Vancouver. I am trained in Vinyasa, Restorative and Yin. As an island girl, I very much enjoy Stand-up Paddle Yoga!

When not on the mat, you’ll find me whipping up vegan treats while dancing to some cool tunes, or reading a self-exploration book.
instructors.name: Bernadette Pacana

instructors.bio:
I am extremely passionate about the human body and achieving optimal health through physical activity, diet and lifestyle. In my classes, you’ll be guided through a practice focused on your breath, optimal alignment, and accessing how you truly feel in your own unique mind and body. I often speak about being true to yourself, regardless of if that means you show up to class on your best or worst day. 

I have been teaching since 2014. Over this time, I have gained a wide variety of teaching experience which has given me the tools to teach to all levels and be attentive to physical limitations and injuries. I love learning about all things wellness and always consider myself a student as well as a teacher. Regardless of why you’ve come onto your mat, my goal is to have you leave my class feeling like you’ve done something great for yourself while also learning a thing or two!
instructors.name: Brooklyn McLaren

instructors.bio:
Move with artistry and athleticism in Tonya Kay's classes harmonizing the precision of dance with the strength-building power of yoga and Pilates.

Drawing from 35 years performing on Broadway, in Hollywood film/tv and touring the world, Tonya Kay brings a unique choreographic quality to traditional sequencing. Expect intelligently designed flows that challenge your balance, cultivate core stability and encourage physical play.  

Whether you're healing, growing, or simply showing up for yourself, her classes honor all bodies and all abilities. Tonya Kay's mission is to help you create your body as a place to feel strong, take pride in, have fun with and come home to through all of life's changes.
instructors.name: Tonya Kay

instructors.bio:
My journey began in 1998 with a paperback version of “The Sivananda Companion to Yoga.” I am an experienced registered yoga teacher level 350 (CYA-E-RYT-350), certified in restorative, kids, Yin, YHot, prenatal, and Ayurveda Yoga.

Pre-Yoga, I got my BA in Criminology wanting to save the world, then got an acupuncture certification wanting to heal the world. In the process, I became a Reiki Master and learned that my earlier aspirations began with me. I am a teacher and foremost a student. I continue to learn from the Feldenkrais method, I-rest Yoga Nidra meditation method, and am enthusiastic about the biotensegrity world in understanding movements. I’m also certified in the Pilates method.
instructors.name: Carine Young

instructors.bio: I am an avid outdoor enthusiast. I was introduced to hot yoga by my girlfriend who knew that I love to take up any physical challenge. I started practicing hot yoga in 2002 and there was no turning back. After two years of consistent practice, I decided to take my teacher training in 2004. I found persistent practice helped me recover from a bicycle accident and also a hip replacement surgery. My choice of service is to help others and I want to share the gifts of this powerful practice with as many people as possible and inspire them to be better yogis! I have also completed Core 40 training, hot Pilates, Yin yoga training and in an effort to become a better teacher.
instructors.name: Carol Ip

instructors.bio:
What should students expect from your classes?
To be challenged and held in an engaging, warm space. 
 
About Me
Gathering in open spaces for movement-based practices is my happy place; I’ve studied lots of things in those places like dance, rhythmic-gymnastics, musical theatre, group fitness and yoga.

I began with independent study in India then completed the 200 hr Teacher Training and hot training at YYOGA. I’ve also taken a variety fitness module trainings like yoga/pilates fusion and dance inspired movement programs.  

My personal practise and my work as a teacher challenge me to deepen my relationship to myself, others, and natural world. My classes aim to be spaces where others can do the same because I believe that those experiences can be transformative and life giving:

Meeting in open spaces–
Engaging in practice–
Bearing witness to one another–
Allowing those experience to change us– 

See you in class!
instructors.name: Christina

instructors.bio: I began my yoga journey while attending my Mum’s hatha classes in my late teens. Discovering yoga as the ultimate tool to connect mind, body and spirit I later went on to complete my Ashtanga and Vinyasa 200 hour training in South Goa, India. I bring a strong, sweaty and grounded style to the mat while intertwining philosophical and creative elements into my practice. My approach is to empower people by helping them drop down into their bodies and find their inner strength and joy. As a musician, I always try my best to keep classes fun and varied combining all kinds of musical genres. I strive to bring yoga directly into the heart of the LGBT+ and male communities, sharing my passion and serving others on a daily basis.
instructors.name: Connor Roff

instructors.bio:
There are many ways to move. I regard yoga as an empowering and transformative practice that should be available to everyone. We are constantly changing and as time passes, we have the opportunity to grow and learn.  Yoga teaches us to be present and active as those changes take place and to be conscious participants in our own evolution.

One of the many things that yoga has taught me is that a few long slow breaths can help to calm the mind and body, making the very scary become less daunting. Through movement guided by breath, I have learnt how to live in a calmer more grounded place. By holding space for people in this way I hope that the yoga I am offering can empower and unite while allowing space and time to clear the mind and create ease in the body.

I did my 200 hour TT in Todos Santos, Mexico, took my hot training with Yyoga in 2012 then my 300 hour TT at the Vancouver School of Yoga. Along with the yoga I am also an artist, an art teacher and an avid cyclist.
instructors.name: Corina Hanson

instructors.bio: Raised by Yogis off the grid & trained in India. I am dedicated to teaching the traditions & practices of yoga with a modern twist. My bubbly personality and infectious laugh will have you stepping out of your comfort zone in a playful way to discover yourself on your mat.
instructors.name: Crystal Rainbow Borrelli

instructors.bio: I believe everyone can benefit from the amazing transformation that comes from a yoga practice. My classes infuse poses that will challenge, increase flexibility, strengthen and detoxify your mind and body. I wish for your journey to re-connect you to your true self. From a heart centred perspective, I encourage students to move from a place of loving empowerment. I believe every single movement and every single breath is a chance to create more space and live more fully. Through drawing inward and tapping into your highest source to shine more brightly and inspire others to do the same. For me yoga practice is an evolution and brings me peace while enjoying the beauty along the way.
instructors.name: Elle Soursos

instructors.bio:
Emily is a born teacher, proud mother of three, and lifelong learner. She received her B.A. and B.Education from UBC in 2000, and has taught as a Certified BC School Teacher for over 20 years. 

Emily has always loved moving. She trained as a ballet dancer until age 14, took up long distance running as a young adult, and skate skiing in her thirties. 

Emily found Pilates in 2009 after suffering a back injury that would not heal using traditional rehabilitation methods. She appreciated having ownership over her healing and strength training as she was guided through the Pilates repertoire. She has earned a Pilates Mat Diploma from Physicalmind Institute Canada, and Pilates Mat, Reformer, and Apparatus Instructor Certification through Balanced Body Education.  

Emily is known for her concise cueing and foundation first teaching.  She teaches multi level large Mat Pilates and Floor Barre classes, as well as Reformer and Apparatus classes at studios on the North Shore and in Vancouver.
instructors.name: Emily Krilanovich

instructors.bio: I first stepped onto my mat in a hot yoga room to develop a consistent fitness routine. A few years later, I discovered YYoga and its many offerings, and immediately connected with the Hatha practice. I enjoyed the refined hold in each posture that allowed me to tune into my body, breath, and mind. I decided to deepen my knowledge and practice by signing up for the 200-hour YTT at YYoga, and was fortunate enough to be under the guidance of Jasmina Egeler and Kate Gillespie. Today, I bring my passion for the Hatha practice to students in various community centres and studios. I believe that yoga is for everyone and every body, so join me on the mat and enjoy steady breaths and mindful movements.
instructors.name: Eric Lin

instructors.bio:
My practice and teaching are rooted in the Ashtanga and Iyengar traditions, placing intentional focus on breath and alignment. My offerings flow from the belief that yoga is an all-encompassing experience and serves as a moving meditation of openness, cleansing, and healing for the mind, body, and spirit. The combination of my dance background, passion for yoga, and innate desire to share this knowledge has been a powerful catalyst fueling my aspiration to teach yoga. 

I completed my 200-Hour YTT and YHot Training in 2018 and 2019, and have been teaching ever since. Yoga has become my anchor, connecting me to life, breath, and self-awareness. It continues to teach me to move past the discomfort through acceptance and perseverance, leading to inner strength, grounding, and peace. In my classes, you can expect a playful yet challenging practice that allows students to cultivate confidence while exploring the mind-body connection.
instructors.name: Erica Thomas

instructors.bio: My yoga practice began a decade ago when I decided to drop into my local YMCA for a yoga class to help mend my hips after 25 years of running. I was gifted to land in a yin class with an amazing teacher, who I followed from that class to her vinyasa class and from to studio to studio. What began as a way to support my running has morphed into a way to support all aspects of my life, and that’s why I wanted to share this amazing practice with others. Since discovering yoga, I am a perpetual student of movement and the human body, currently working through a Kinesiology diploma and getting certified in the Functional Movement Screen, and taking anatomy and movement training whenever I can. That shows up in my teaching in a focus on alignment, in curiosity and intention, and encouraging students to find strength, stillness, or openness they didn’t know they had.
instructors.name: Glenda Savage

instructors.bio:
I began practicing yoga at the age of 12 and haven’t stopped since. Big shout out to my mom for making me take my first-ever yoga class with her. My passion for yoga has lead me down many different avenues. I’ve found wisdom through hot, vinyasa, hatha, yin, restorative, and aerial styles of practice. In addition, I’ve gained clarity in my life through my continual study of yogic philosophy.

I did both my 200-hour vinyasa/hatha based training, as well as 50 hours of aerial yoga teacher training, on the island of Koh Phangan in Thailand. I am also a trained massage therapist and I hope to one day blend these two special gifts of mine together.
instructors.name: Hayley Secret

instructors.bio:
Hello everyone! If you are thinking of attending one of my classes for the first time, here is a little bit about me. I have been teaching yoga for 12 years and have been a dedicated yogi for at least 17 years. I am a member of the YYoga faculty for YHot Teacher Training. Along with teaching Hatha, Power, Flow, Pilates, and Core Strength; I also love teaching corporate, youth seniors, zoom and even dog yoga!

For those of you that know me, I love my Old English Sheep Dog – Humphrey! He’s my best friend and brings inspiration me everyday.

I have also organized or participated in yoga retreats, yoga in the park, Ted X, and even yoga on the top of Grouse Mountain. I’m also very proud to represent companies like Lululemon, VEGA, and The Green Channel as an ambassador.

When you come to one of my classes, you can expect clear instruction, a singing bowl, mantras, and stories that I hope you will remember for the rest of your life! Namaste.
instructors.name: Hillary Keegan

instructors.bio: My passion for hot yoga started in my teens, throughout my life yoga has been a constant. The connections I’ve made with others has been life changing and, the relationship with my self has grown and changed in so many ways not just physically, but mentally and spiritually. I want to give students the love, guidance, knowledge, encouragement and nurturing I received. I promise to guide each person through their yoga journey with safe alignment, and love. I love the heat, the detoxification process and being able to go deeper in our bodies. Let’s sweat together sharing and moving our energy as one!
instructors.name: Jamila Hamid

instructors.bio:
I took my first class in 2003 and quickly found, in the busyness of life, a challenging practice of coming home to myself. Over the years yoga has invited me to come back to the present moment, breathe through tension and grief, increase mobility and flexibility, and build strength. After many years of classes, workshops, and trainings, I began teaching in 2019.

My teaching is influenced and informed by many lineages and modalities including Vinyasa, Flow, Vinyasa Krama, Hatha, Restorative, Iyengar, Anusara, Movement Method, Mindfulness, and Pranayama. My classes are creative and intentional. Each breath, each movement is an opportunity to find balance – between strength and softness, form and function, rigidity and fluidity. I am passionate about daily movement on and off the mat and sharing yoga in community is my favorite way to explore the ways we can move through the world.
instructors.name: Jane Hill

instructors.bio: My first yoga experience was in 2000 in the Ashtanga tradition. I developed a deep love for the practice which led me to take my first teacher training in 2009. I started teaching as soon as I received my teaching certification. I spent four years teaching in non traditional settings, on the downtown east side and at the Burnaby Youth Custody Centre. In 2013, I transitioned out of my full time profession to teaching yoga. YYOGA has been my home since then. You can find me teaching Power and Flow classes here and also leading 200 Hour Teacher Training programs.
instructors.name: Jasmina Egeler

instructors.bio:
I began practicing yoga over 20 years ago in an effort to find some balance in my busy life and law practice. Kelly and I met in 2001 and would go on to open Flow Yoga Studio, create the Flow Teacher Training Program and produce the TV program ‘Flow Yoga with Kelly and Jason’. 

Over the years I have maintained a steady practice in a variety of types of yoga and have been very fortunate to have learned from the many amazing teachers and students at Flow. These influences have helped Kelly and I to develop their particular version of 'Flow' Yoga. Firmly grounded in the Krishnamacharia lineage, we draw from the many rich traditions of Ashtanga, Iyengar, Vijnana, Sivananda, Vinyasa Flow and Anusara Yoga.
instructors.name: Jason Hagemeister

instructors.bio:
I studied with the incomparable Daniel Clement to obtain my 240 hour teacher training certification in 2011. I have trained with Yyoga’s mentorship program under the tutelage of Clara Roberts-Oss, completed Leslie Kaminoff and Amy Matthews’s Yoga Anatomy program via Pacific Elements, and studied meditation with Carlos Pomeda. I have been leading classes at Yyoga since 2014 and I am a member of the Yyoga teacher training faculty.

For me, Yoga offers a safe space to practice discernment and loving acceptance. The physical practice offers me insight from a truthful place and those discoveries from the mat are what make me the awesome, work in progress human that I am today. I believe Yoga is a dedicated daily practice, the purpose of which is not to change us, but to reveal our highest self and to remind of us of our deep and abiding connection to one another.
instructors.name: Jayme Burke

instructors.bio:
Yoga and fitness have always been an integral part of my life. Movement, as I have experienced first-hand and know deeply, is a key ingredient in reclaiming our bodies and selves, restoring balance, and reviving our lives. I am known for my clear, authentic, and non-judgmental teaching style; as well as my ability to weave compassion-centered philosophy and relatable themes through class. I encourage the continuous growth of the physical and spiritual self, offering parts of my Self and the extensive and varied educational findings I have collected through my own life journey.

I have been teaching yoga since 2006 in studios, schools, private residences, and corporations in Toronto and, now, the Lower Mainland. I am Hatha-trained (through a 320-hour program with The Yoga Studio Toronto) under the mentorship of Cynthia Cooperstone, Michael Siddall, Vieslav Krystyan, and others who have modeled authenticity and joy in the practice and instruction of yoga.
instructors.name: Jennifer Pun

instructors.bio:
I am trained in traditional Hatha Yoga, with certification in Trauma Sensitive and Pre & Postnatal Yoga. I have studied with Swami Muktibodhananda, Swami Mahesh and am currently studying Ayurveda and Yoga with Dr. David Frawley (Pandit Vamadeva Shastri) at the American Institute of Vedic Studies. I weave the wisdom of Ayurveda and the eight limbs of yoga into my classes, in a way that students can relate to and apply in their daily life.

My classes focus on restoring one’s energy, calming the mind, and strengthening one’s body, while providing a sacred space to connect with one’s higher Self.
instructors.name: Jeremy Laroya

instructors.bio:
With a lifetime background of dance, sports and a Kinesiology degree focused on secondary phys ed, Jess brings an empowering coach energy to her classes.  You'll be listening to deep house and some chill downtempo and be put to sleep during a luxurious shavasana.  

Jess brings strong energy, alignment-focused direction, and provides hands on adjustments.

You'll be encouraged to take breaks as you need them, be willing to fall, and to meet your yogic community around you.
instructors.name: Jess Dexter

instructors.bio: In my class, you can expect a focused practice with touches of humour and lightness. My teaching style is often very anatomically- and alignment-driven, yet also aims to inspire beautiful movement. In addition to being a yoga instructor, I am also a practising physiotherapist: in both these realms, the resilience and adaptability of the human body continue to inspire me daily. I look forward to seeing you on the mat.
instructors.name: Josh Chen

instructors.bio:
I have been teaching Mat Pilates since 2006. I am also currently working on the Reformer, Cadillac and Chair with clients of different ages, strengths and abilities. I enjoy teaching small groups where I can pay attention to detail, with focus on alignment and breath. I am passionate about my clients becoming stronger while they regain mobility, ease of movement and confidence.

I am also certified in Yoga and Yin Yoga, and apply some of the stretching techniques to my teaching style. My classes offer props and modifications in order to create a more challenging workout, while at the same time being inclusive of a wide range of strengths and postural limitations.

I look forward to seeing you in my classes!
instructors.name: Joanne Borek-Rog

instructors.bio:
My practice began about 20 years ago. Years of competitive sports had me wound so tight that it took nearly a year to touch my toes. There was an immediate shift in my hamstrings, but the far more profound shift in my whole being was what hooked me. Yoga is magic. After nearly a decade of practice, I pursued her first teacher training program in Costa Rica, with the intention of deepening my personal practice and having an extended vacation from a demanding finance career. The rest is history. 

I credit the depth of my practice and love of yoga to the many esteemed teachers I have studied with over the years, particularly Annie Carpenter, Schuyler Grant, Nikki Villela, Carrie Owerko, and Abbie Galvin. My teaching is also informed and inspired by Functional Movement Systems. I teach public classes in Vancouver, and workshops, trainings, and retreats all over the world. I also offer virtual classes through my online platform, Movement Method.
instructors.name: Kate Gillespie

instructors.bio:
I have always been enamoured with physical movement and felt empowered by its therapeutic benefits. It wasn’t until my early teenage years that I was first introduced to the Yoga Asana and it has forever changed the way I experience the world around me. I fell in love with the external expression of the practice, but also felt illuminated by its internal teachings. For many years, my passion for yoga, tempered by a background in strength training, has provided me a perfect, harmonious balance for body and mind.

In my classes, we integrate the physical experience into spiritual awareness by cultivating focus, reflection, and exploring areas of ourselves that may be unfamiliar. For the duration of class, it’s just you, your body, your breath, and nothing else. As an introvert, this practice is a time and place where I feel especially at home – it is my purpose as a teacher to make my students feel the same.
instructors.name: Katrina Chan

instructors.bio:
My yoga practice and teaching journey began over 20 years ago in San Francisco, California where, after my first 200 hour teacher training, I managed and taught vinyasa yoga at one of the largest Ashtanga schools in the US. This incredible experience led me to Vancouver where I met my husband Jason, also a yoga teacher and together, we opened three local yoga studios, created and led two seasons of “Flow Yoga” for channel M television, and designed and led our own comprehensive 200 hour yoga teacher training program for five years.

In 2007, we partnered with YYOGA and started building the community to bring it to life and what it is today.

My passion for teaching functional movement in the Pilates and yoga systems has been steadfast and mentoring teachers and growing our community continues to bring me pride and joy every day.
instructors.name: Kelly Colleen

instructors.bio: I am a certified yoga teacher from Richmond BC. I have my RYT-200 Hour and YHot certification. I have a passion for helping others in obtaining a healthy lifestyle, and bringing balance on and off the mat. My goal is to help empower and inspire all that I can!
instructors.name: Kirstin Clark

instructors.bio:
Teaching yoga will always be my first love. Additionally, I work full time 1:1 helping women who struggle with flight anxiety feel calm, safe, and confident in the sky so they can enjoy travel again.

I experienced my first yoga class in 1997 and practiced almost daily for two years, loving how it transformed my life. I began teaching Hatha Yoga in 1999. Between 2004-2006, I traveled to India for nine months studying backbending and asana. From 2005-2008, I studied Yin Yoga with Sarah Powers and Zen Meditation with Shakti Mhi.

My Hatha classes are traditional, unhurried, and light in energy, while my Yin classes honor the original meridian-based practice. Outside of yoga, I’m a certified EFT Tapping, Emotion Code, EQ Life Coach, and Bio Energy practitioner.
instructors.name: Lara Catherine

instructors.bio:
I came to YYoga initially to recover from a sports injury and fell in love with the philosophy, discipline and studio community. My background in kinesiology and work as a certified Medical Exercise Specialist was a natural fit for developing my practice and completing several teacher trainings.

Through the discipline of study, meditation and regular practice, I have found that my attitude towards life has become more accepting of and even inspired by challenges: the implementation of practice off the mat. I encourage my students to approach every class with curiosity, patience and non-judgment: “An open mind learns best”.
instructors.name: Laurie Smith

instructors.bio: In my class, you will experience mindfulness, connect with yourself and the world around you. I encourage you to cultivate loving and kindness, acceptance, and non-judgment. You will leave my class feeling one step closer to be back home: the reunion of your body, mind, and spirit.
instructors.name: Linda Li

instructors.bio: I am a Yoga Alliance Certified 500 Hour E-RYT with over 1000 hours of additional training in yoga and other complimentary movement modalities. I have been teaching yoga for 13 years and joined the YYOGA Education faculty as a YHot teacher trainer 3 years ago. I am also a registered Professional Counsellor and a Certified Life Coach which adds depth to my yoga classes as I emphasize self-awareness and personal agency. With clear, simple cueing I will guide you through your practice and help you find your calm, grounded centre so you can step back into the world feeling refreshed, focused and alive.
instructors.name: Lisa Sanson

instructors.bio:
I bring to all my classes clear and precise cues, creative sequencing, uplifting ideas, and… myself. I am a cat mama who loves dance and cake, and learning everyday what it means to live a heart-centred life. For every class I teach, I aim to show up fully as myself and ensure that all students feel seen.

I am deeply grateful to my friend who convinced me to try my first yoga class in my early 20’s. Over the years, I have practiced in all sorts of weird spaces and with different teachers from diverse backgrounds. I found that the teachers I kept going back to created a space where I could feel protected enough – free enough – to fully let go and dive deeper. Now in my 7th year of teaching, I hope that I can do the same, and make each class a welcoming space for introspection and exploration.
instructors.name: Loretta Siu

instructors.bio: Because I started practising Yoga & Ayurveda in 1996, you’ll step into an experiential guidance of traditional knowledge in my class with a touch of humour. As a practising yoga therapist, I have a curiosity for innovative yoga anatomy that is holistic so you may transform your self-awareness and notice more self-acceptance and freedom over time. As the Co-director of my yoga school, I have taught more than 10,000 hours in yoga teacher training programs. I aim to guide you toward your “inner knower,” a place of calm, resiliency, and enduring stability. I’m a student at heart and I have learned to appreciate my mistakes. Warning: If you’re in the right class, you’ll get a Vedic story.
instructors.name: Lucy St. John

instructors.bio:
Movement, discipline, art and nature have been pillars for me since early childhood and greatly influence me as a yoga teacher. Royal Academy of Dance classical ballet training began for me at the age of four and continued for over a decade; at which point I discovered and fell in love with Hip Hop. Having the good fortune to spend time and study in New York, I immersed myself in street art, especially dance. I spent more than two decades training/competing in and teaching hip-hop, breaking and freestyle dance. 

I began practicing yoga in 2000 as a supplement to my work; and by 2005 I was hooked. Through my own studies and attending workshops I became deeply committed to and passionate about yoga; and completed my formal teacher training. My style of yoga is rooted in: Iyengar, Vinyasa and Anusara traditions; with great influence from The Franklin Method.
instructors.name: Lyndsey Carr

instructors.bio: I am a yoga, mindfulness, and meditation teacher – a mother, writer, dancer, ceremonialist, and spiritual coach. I am deeply passionate about weaving the art of mindfulness, creativity, mind-body practices and earth-centric rituals into my life and my work.  I have been studying yoga for thirty years and teaching locally and abroad for the past two decades. My teaching affirmation is “come as you are” and for every student to feel connected and nourished through my yoga sessions.  I run international yoga retreats, corporate leadership programs and online coaching and personal development courses. I am the author of “Ritual As Remedy: Embodied Practices for Soul Care, and “Sage, Huntress, Lover, Queen: Access Your Power and Creativity through Sacred Female Archetypes.” She is also a regular contributor for Spirituality and Health, and Wanderlust.
instructors.name: Mara Branscombe

instructors.bio: I started teaching yoga in 2008, and shortly after I began I left my job in the healthcare field. My teaching career has been mostly based out of Vancouver but I have also taught overseas in Asia for a short period of time as well. I teach an alignment-based practice that is dynamic and accessible for students of all levels. I encourage you to move at your own pace and to listen to how your body is feeling at that moment in time. I provide a safe and welcoming space for my students to explore their own practice and to dive a little deep into their own self-journey. My hopes are for you to leave my class feeling empowered and motivated to continue on in your yoga journey, and to embrace living a peaceful life both on and off your mat. I look forward to seeing you in my class.
instructors.name: Marcus Tong

instructors.bio:
Physical Movement has always been where I’ve felt the most at home and free- a form of self-expression that helps me find truth and explore parts of myself otherwise hidden. 

When I started my yoga practice I realized the opportunity to connect even more deeply with the intimate wisdom of the physical body and the heart through stillness and through breath. 

I teach an alignment-based practice of movement and breath that is challenging yet accessible – a flow that is dynamic, strong and fluid with lots of opportunity to get rooted through the hands and play upside down. I believe growth comes from the willingness to challenge ourselves and experience things that take us outside of our comfort zone. Transformation occurs when we bravely step into the unknown and allow ourselves to be open, vulnerable and free.
instructors.name: Mari Dickey

instructors.bio: I aim to bring a balanced class through passion and curiosity. I grew up playing numerous physical sports & and found Yoga in 2009 as a way to ease sore muscles. I quickly found more depth and passion within the practice and Yoga became a way of life. With increased curiosity and love of the practice, I completed YYoga’s 200hr & YHot RYT. My classes offer a passion for movement, in a grounded but curious space.
instructors.name: Meghan Ross

instructors.bio: I’ve been teaching classes for over 15 years and I continue to upgrade my education and certifications. Not only do I inspire students, but students inspire me. It’s a lifelong journey to always improve oneself but to also acknowledge the awesomeness of the present moment.
instructors.name: Michelle Weisbom

instructors.bio:
Michelle is a 500 Hour certified yoga teacher with a deep passion for the mind-body connection. Her journey with yoga began as a way to calm anxiety and cultivate presence and it has evolved into a practice of self discovery and energetic awareness. She has been mentored by and is deeply inspired by the teachings of Crystal Rainbow Borrelli.

What to expect: 

With a grounding presence and an emphasis on sensation and inclusivity, Michelle creates a safe space for students to connect more deeply with themselves.  Michelle loves the connections she makes with her students and looks forward to sharing the energetic, mythical and spiritual aspects of yoga.  Expect to learn more about the traditional lineage of yoga, yourself, and to laugh a little.
instructors.name: Michelle Clausius

instructors.bio: I have been teaching classes for 25 years, after being a Fitness/Dance instructor for more than 10 years, I started practicing Yoga & Pilates, In a way I wanted to find balance in my body and mind. I am an eternal student. I love taking new courses and learning new things. Mixing Yoga/Pilates/Fitness/Dance makes my life full of excitement. I love different aspects of movement and I get inspired by mixing all my discoveries through my journey. I hope you get inspired too!
instructors.name: Mercedes Sanchez Garcia

instructors.bio:
After practicing yoga for years in my hometown in Spain, I moved to Canada and decided to study more about this lifestyle that had literally changed my life. I took my 200 hr YTT with Rachel Scott, Jasmina Egeler and Mari Dickey at YYOGA in 2019 and started sharing this wonderful practice that same year. I have also taken other trainings like Hot Yoga, Meditation for Yoga Teachers and Aerial Yoga. I would like to keep studying and keep learning as a part of my own journey.

Students can expect from my classes thoughtful sequences and flow movements that open the body, and bring the mind into presence. I like including pranayama (breath) in all the yoga styles I teach, which allows for a complete experience and invites us to stay more focus in the practice. My favorite classes include balancing poses, heart openings, hip openers, strength and flexibility challenges and, above all, much fun!
instructors.name: Paula Nicolau

instructors.bio: Clear instruction with attention to form, alignment and technique. Students will receive a class that is both challenging and inclusive. Providing options for varying levels of ability and using messages of motivation and empowerment, participants are taken through a comprehensive series of functional exercises that promote strength, endurance, flexibility and well-being. Come with an open mind to try something different and a willingness to laugh…because everything is better when we do it with a smile.
instructors.name: Portia Mann

instructors.bio:
My yoga journey started in 2013 with SivanandaYoga, Ashtanga and Iyengar traditions. I decided to pursue my passion for yoga, so I attended Yoga teacher training in 2017 followed by another training in Ashtanga Assisting School in Toronto. Meanwhile, I was studying fitness and health promotion to learn more about anatomy and body movements that I could integrate into my yoga sequences and teaching.

I have learned about our body and its amazing abilities through Yoga. It taught me that transformation is a journey that should be taken slowly and mindfully. While practice and consistency is essential to make progress, being fully present in the moment is the key. It was a turning point in my life when I realized this. My passion is to design sequences of yoga asanas while considering fitness principles. In practice, I use verbal cues to focus on body alignment, gazing points and mindful breathing. Challenging yoga movements have uncovered my deep emotions which led to moments of relief.
instructors.name: Proshat Fard

instructors.bio:
I have been practicing yoga since 2010 and teaching since 2014. It is my own personal practice which nourishes me, and you will find me as a student on the mat most days, gaining insight and inspiration from my community of fellow teachers and yogis. I was first introduced to yoga to when my acting teacher brought in a yoga teacher for a special workshop. Inspired by the experience, I joined YYOGA, where I was able to explore breath and movement in a way that helped her connect deeper, both to herself and to those around me. This led me to complete a 200-Hour Teacher Training in 2014 with YYOGA. 

My classes are a warm invitation to let go of doing, and get into feeling. “Your only job is to breathe, and to watch yourself breathe”. The end goal practicing yoga is not about getting stronger in the poses, but about practicing presence so you can show up in your life off the mat.
instructors.name: Quynh Mi

instructors.bio:
About Me 

I took my first yoga class in Australia in 2001. Within my first few classes I discovered a sense of calm and balance in my body I had never experienced before. From there, began a lifelong journey into the practice of yoga that would help me connect with my own innate internal strength, peace and wisdom.  

I completed all my foundational training – 200hr YTT, YHot YTT, Yin YTT – with YYOGA, my home for yoga over the past decade. I love teaching and bringing this practice to people from all walks of life for its potential to truly transform lives.

What to expect from my class?

A dynamic and challenging class for all levels, with a focus on alignment, empowerment and the practical everyday application of yogic philosophy. Through the breath and asana, students learn to connect more deeply with their innate internal strength, peace and wisdom of body and mind.
instructors.name: Rebecca Lee Henderson

instructors.bio:
With an original background in dance and theatre, I first came to yoga to find another form of expression through my body. I immediately fell in love with the endless possibilities not only to expand the body but also the mind. Yoga carries me to a place where I can feel fully connected in body, mind and spirit.

I have been guiding and mentoring students through my teaching for over 15 years and I am forever grateful to the many teachers and students who have inspired me along the way. I am a RYT-500 and ERYT-500 teacher and have been co-leading teacher trainings for a decade. I teach inspiring classes full of breath awareness, curiosity in movement and attention to alignment in the body, in both Vinyasa Power Flow and Hatha style classes.

I am always seeking to learn and discover more through master teachers such as Janet Stone, Max Strom, Rod Stryker, and more. I am currently studying positive psychology through the Flourishing Center to deepen my emotional support to students.
instructors.name: Rebecca Hollingworth

instructors.bio: Hi! My name is Reith and I am a trauma-informed yoga teacher on the stolen land of the Coast Salish peoples, in what we now call Vancouver.  Yoga has been a part of my life since I was a youth, and the practice has been my steadiest companion throughout periods of depression, celebration, and everything in between. In 2023, I completed a 200hr teacher training with the amazing trainers at YYOGA, and a trauma-informed training through Yoga Outreach. My goal as a teacher is to create a welcoming, non-judgemental environment where everyone from beginners to experienced practitioners can experience moments of a calm mind through focus on breath, sensation, and eye gaze. The power of yoga to regulate our nervous systems and make friends with our bodies is such an incredible tool and it is my deepest honour and privilege to share this ancient South Asian practice with others.
instructors.name: Reith Charlesworth

instructors.bio: I have been practicing yoga for more than 35 years. In 2010 I discovered Power Yoga and found a practice that challenged and empowered me. I offer a practice for students of all levels and support students to find a connection to the mind, body, and heart. My passion for yoga continues to deepen as I continue to learn and to share this powerful and potent practice.
instructors.name: Rika Lange

instructors.bio: My practice began 15 years ago. I was inspired to try yoga as a recuperation from a lingering shoulder injury. My experience during this time opened many new doors and eventually motivated me to pursue a career in yoga. Initially I took Sivananda Yoga and Yoga Nidra classes. My first teacher training in 2013 taught me the importance of commitment and dedication to daily practice. However, it was not until I took my first Power yoga class two years later that I realized power yoga was my true calling. To this day, you will find me most happy when I am on my mat and helping students reach their full potential.
instructors.name: Samaneh Asgharzadeh

instructors.bio: My name is Robyn, and I am truly honored to be here with you. My wellness journey truly began after some big life changes. I was in a challenging place and my mat was my safe space. I turned to yoga and really started to dig deep. I have learned so much about who I am and what I want to share with you. Life will not always be easy but when we prioritize our minds, bodies, and souls we unlock our full potential to rise. I cannot wait to sweat, connect and thrive with all of you.
instructors.name: Robyn Hnat

instructors.bio:
My yoga practice emerged from insights into pain from playing hard. I tore my achilles heel in the passion of flamenco dance. From this hot spot, add an achey chest from asthma and a sensitive heart, I was ripe for the yoga fire of transformation. In 2007, I dove into training in the healing science and spirit of yoga and realized – Wow, this will be a life long adventure in wisdom! Opening the energetic gateway to freedom through hatha, vinyasa and yin asana coupled with meditation has led to artful suppleness and strength as well as the unexpected bonus of enough humour to absorb the unruly and delightful challenges of life.

We weren’t born with an owner’s manual. However, practicing yoga will help you understand your unique physiology, history, habits, and attitude that will creatively inform your awareness and capacity for happiness. You can’t help but improve physically and mentally.
instructors.name: Sandra Stephanson

instructors.bio: I was originally drawn to teacher training to deepen my own personal practice, but quickly realized that I wanted to share my passion and love of yoga with others. I love the compassionate nature of yoga and how students of any level can find what they’re looking for in their practice.
instructors.name: Sarah Gallagher

instructors.bio: A student of yoga since 2005, and my path has been deeply shaped by the intersections of movement, philosophy, and healing. I’ve studied Jivamukti Yoga, trained in trauma-informed approaches, and I’m a continuing student of non-dual tantric traditions, which deeply inform both my personal practice and teaching. As a somatic therapist, I bring a sensitivity to the nervous system into my classes—inviting a pace and presence that supports both embodiment and integration. My teaching is grounded in the belief that practice is not about striving or fixing, but about remembering what’s already healthy and whole. Expect a blend of breath, guided embodiment practices, and spacious inner inquiry.
instructors.name: Sam Trivett

instructors.bio:
As a native British Columbian, my roots are grounded in the rolling hills of the Okanagan Valley. Innately raised with a passion for fitness and health, I began my true journey towards complete body wellness at the age of sixteen. Channeling a fulfillment of my desire to nurture others, I began teaching freestyle dance, as a way to connect creativity with the fluidity of the body.

Along my travels to different corners of the world, I gained a deeper respect for the practice of yoga. Through the teachings of Don and Amba Stapleton, at the Nosara Yoga Institute, I studied the fundamentals of Interdisciplinary Yoga as a way to move and channel excess energy back into the earth. In search of deeper understanding of the mechanics of the physical body, I discovered acclaimed YogaWorks instructor Gerhard Gessner. With his guidance, I adopted yoga as an everyday lifestyle approach towards the pathway to longevity.
instructors.name: Sarah Fuson

instructors.bio: I have been practicing yoga since my teen years, and have undergone several teacher trainings including 200 hr, YHot, Vinyasa Sequencing, Kundalini, Core, and Fitness Theory. Experiential immersions in Chanting, Intentional Dance, and Thai Massage have taught me the subtle art of witnessing and teaching to multi-faceted beings. I love holding space for others to feel radiantly alive and embodied with awareness.
instructors.name: Sasha Smith

instructors.bio: I fell in love with yoga during my first class and have been practicing ever since. The physical, mental, & spiritual benefits of the practice became an integral part of my life on and off the mat, and teaching was the next step in giving back to the nourishing yoga community. During the pandemic, I took my 200 Hour YTT – a really rewarding and meaningful journey during a challenging time. I specialize in YHot, Flow & Hatha styles, and incorporate elements of nature, self-love & gratitude.
instructors.name: Sonja Frolek

instructors.bio: I had gone to some yoga in my teens and early twenties but it wasn’t until I came to my first class at YYOGA Northshore Elements in February 2009 that I was hooked. I didn’t realize that I was holding my breath a lot of my day and that was leading to anxiety. That was the beginning of a beautiful journey. Every time I get on my mat I feel like I’m home. In the summer of 2014 I decided to take my Teacher Training at YYOGA and started teaching soon after that. Yoga for me is so much more than just the physical practice and I encourage students to explore their practice in their own life.
instructors.name: Tamara Silveri

instructors.bio: Tiagra is a personal trainer and yoga teacher who is focused on functionality, balance, and embodying the entire self. In her classes you can expect a blend of action and acceptance, which challenges you to dig a big deeper, whether it's mentally or physically.
instructors.name: Tia Desrochers

instructors.bio:
Zander has been teaching yoga and meditation for over 10 years, and is passionate about providing traditional instruction in the lineage of Sri Krishnamacharya. He holds E-RYT 500 status with Yoga Alliance, having logged over 1000 hours in training and 4,500 hours of yoga instruction. Zander also holds Ayurvedic Yoga Specialist certification via the Himalayan Institute, Advanced Teacher Training certification in Vinyasa Krama with Srivatsa Ramaswami, Yoga Therapy Teacher Training certification with Manju Jois, as well as deep study in Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga with Fiona Stang and other senior teachers.

Zander is also a Yoga Teacher Trainer, having co-facilitated 200 Hour programs for hundreds of students in Vancouver. He holds an MA in philosophy (2010) and is currently completing a second graduate degree at UBC where he is translating and examining the Yoga Yājñavalkya, an important haṭha yoga text in the Sri Krishnamacharya tradition.
instructors.name: Zander Winther

instructors.bio:
Irene (she/her) is a vinyasa, yin, and hot yoga asana teacher who teaches a grounding class for students who are on a journey of deepening their yoga practice. She enjoys offering creative vinyasa flow classes, mindful yin classes, and strong hot yoga classes. She is an intersectional and spiritual feminist that believes in yoga as a transformative practice of self-awareness and collective freedom. 

She has primarily trained with Clara Roberts-Oss (vinyasa), Bernie Clark, Sarah Lo (yin), and Kristin Campbell (hot). Her continuing education interests include yoga history, philosophy, and intersectionality equity and teachers include Luvena Rangel, Eliana Chinea, Kallie Rebel YogaTribe, and Yoga Outreach. She recently completed her 300 hours in multi-style yoga in Bali.
instructors.name: Irene Lo

instructors.bio:
I started my journey through movement as a ballet dancer at the age of four and was introduced to Yoga and Pilates along the way.  After I retired from dance my focus shifted to deepening my yoga practice and connecting more to what my body and spirit needed. That led me to completing my 200Hr hatha + Vinyasa training with Yogacara in 2015 and other trainings in YHot, Mat and Reformer Pilates followed.

In my classes, I aim to create a supportive and challenging space for exploration. I emphasize functional movement, building stability for long-term freedom in body, mind, and spirit. I value balance—challenge and rest, strength and surrender, effort and ease—and I love incorporating music to elevate the vibe! Whether you’re brand new to movement or looking to deepen your practice, I’d love to meet you where you’re at.✌️🪷
instructors.name: Kris Aggerholm

instructors.bio:
Meltem’s lifetime passion for dance and music makes her classes a playful dance through breath and asana while keeping a strong focus on a safe yet strong practice.. Reconnect with your true spirit and love for life. Live, love, laugh and let loose a little is her life motto. Meltem sees yoga as her soul food and  a way of life not merely a physical practice. She adores yoga and practices what she preaches,  you can find her on the mat next to yours any day :-)

She was certified in Vinyasa Yoga in New York City in 2012  where she also completed her Kids Teacher’s Training. With her arrival to Vancouver, she has completed her 500 Hour Advanced Teacher's Training at YYOGA and 40 hour 'Vinyasa Immersion' with Clara Robert-Oss in Prana flow of Shiva Rea, as well as yin, hot, aerial yoga and Pilates teacher trainings throughout her 13 years of teaching. 

She can’t wait to see you on your magic carpets :-)
instructors.name: Meltem Oner

instructors.bio: I’ve been teaching various styles of Yoga since 2002- from Power, Anusara Inspired, and Ashtanga Vinyasa, to Hatha, Yin and Restorative. My classes are opportunities to cultivate a deeper awareness and sense of belonging in our bodies, minds, and communities. I love to create non-intimidating spaces for all bodies to feel comfortable to be themselves, without judgement. I aim to offer therapeutic embodiment experiences that meet students where they are, and empower them to do what feels best for them from moment to moment. I'm passionate about helping fitness and movement spaces be more inclusive and accessible, offering a variety of choice-based options to meet individual needs. We will use conscious breath, mindful movement, and deep stillness to explore the human experience together.
instructors.name: Maggie Anderson

instructors.bio:
As a Hatha, Vinyasa and Power Yoga teacher, my goal has always been to share my passion for body and mind wellness through the wisdom of Yoga and all that it encompasses. I have done 400h of training with Yoga Sangha in Montreal and have taught classes and workshops in both Montreal and Vancouver.

I love to build creative sequences that are both dynamic and soothing - allowing my students to leave the space feeling revigorated.
Intuitive and inspired, every one of my classes is built with presence and acceptance as the foundation and movement and breath as the medicine.
instructors.name: Rose Joly

instructors.bio:
Your training background :
Aya, a dedicated yoga and Pilates instructor. Aya's journey with yoga began in 2009 and Pilates in 2017, practices that have become sources of strength and balance through life’s highs and lows. Aya believes that yoga and Pilates offer a unique blend of physical and mental harmony, connecting body and mind in a profound way.

What to expect from your classes :
In Aya’s classes, you’ll find a warm and welcoming environment where you can discover your inner calmness and strength. Focused on strengthening your core, improving flexibility, and enhancing body alignment with mindfulness breath work.
instructors.name: Aya Ito

instructors.bio:
Since 2011, I have been offering workshops, courses and global retreats in addition to private and group classes. I am a yoga teacher mentor and yoga teacher trainer specializing in yoga postures, sequencing and the business of teaching yoga. 

My teachings centre around a few major themes: self-compassion, anatomy-informed sequencing, cultivation of strength, celebrating diversity and curiosity with what’s possible. All of these qualities are taught with big doses of kindness and humour. 

I live in Vancouver, B.C. with my wife, Christa and our two cats, Piccolo and Pipa. I have a deep love for composting, rereading Harry Potter and being in any body of water. If I could live off of one food for the rest of my life without consequences it would be ice cream.
instructors.name: Katarina Wittkamp

instructors.bio:
After I had to let go of my Great Dane, Echo, I found myself diving into Pilates as a way to work through my grief and find new direction. It felt like Echo was leading me to this practice, so I went on to become a certified instructor in her honor. Every class I teach is a nod to her—reflecting the grace and strength she brought into my life. Now, I’m passionate about helping others discover healing and balance through Pilates, inspired by the same compassion and dedication Echo gave me.


Get ready for a Pilates class that packs a punch! Expect a powerful workout that challenges your strength, flexibility, and core, all while keeping the mood upbeat and lively. With intense exercises you'll be pushed to your limits but with a smile on your face. Come prepared for a serious workout with a playful twist—you’ll leave feeling strong, balanced, and ready for more!
instructors.name: Clarence

instructors.bio:
Hi, my name is Helia. My journey with yoga began as a way to reconnect with my body and calm my mind, but it soon evolved into a deeper practice of awareness, compassion, and balance. I completed my 200-hour Yoga Teacher Training at YYOGA, followed by YHot and Traditional Vinyasa & Philosophy trainings.

In my classes, you can expect a mindful and grounding flow that weaves breath, movement, and presence together. I invite students to explore the balance between effort and ease, to listen deeply to their bodies, and to move with intention rather than expectation. Each class is a gentle reminder to return home to yourself — one breath at a time.

With gratitude and blessings, see you on the mat.
instructors.name: Helia

instructors.bio:
I first discovered yoga in 2010. What started as a search for balance and a way to stretch my hamstrings from running quickly evolved into a deep passion. This passion led me to complete my first 200-hour training in 2012. Since then, I’ve been dedicated to teaching and sharing the transformative power of yoga.

I teach with clarity, passion, and purpose, creating classes that challenge, energize, and inspire. My approach blends strength, breath, and mindfulness, encouraging students to move with intention and discover their own potential—both on and off the mat.

Join me for a class that is sure to empower you, challenge you, and connect you to your best self.
instructors.name: Dustin Handley

instructors.bio:
My yoga journey began with brief dalliances 4 decades ago, but I became committed to a regular practice in the early 2000s when I began studying the ashtanga vinyasa method. Everything changed: my career, my body, my diet… over the years I have completed numerous workshops and retreats in various countries with teachers from the Sivananda, Ashtanga, Iyengar, Anusara, Vijnana and Yin lineages. I completed a 240-hour enriched teacher training at the Vancouver School of Yoga, a 50-hour yin teacher training at Semperviva and mentorships at YYOGA and Yoga4StiffGuys. 

I am a father, a partner, a runner, a chef, a holistic nutritionist, a personal trainer; my yoga practice is informed by all of these now, it begins with the breath and is about exploring the edges of our mobility and strength while moving our bodies safely.

I look forward to seeing you on the mat!
instructors.name: Robert Wilson-Smith

instructors.bio:
I’ve always been deeply passionate about movement, anatomy, and health. As a professional dancer and dance instructor, I’ve had the privilege of continuously engaging with my body and exploring different movement modalities. When I discovered yoga, it became a powerful tool for personal growth. It helped me find stillness, overcome challenges, heal my hormones, and most importantly, reconnect with my body/spirit. Yoga has been transformative for me, and I’m passionate about sharing that same healing and empowerment with others. I hold a BA in Foreign Languages & Cultural Studies from UBC, and I completed my 200-hour YTT with a focus on the Iyengar method. My goal in every class is to create a safe and supportive space where students feel free, inspired, and seen — no matter their experience level.

Students in my class can expect creative and thematic flows inspired by nature, philosophy, or culture — all within a safe space where they can feel both challenged and empowered.
instructors.name: Katherine Robidoux

instructors.bio:
Carly is a movement teacher with over 20 years of experience helping people reconnect with their bodies through pilates, yoga, and mindful movement. With a background in Physiotherapy and certifications in Classical Pilates, Hatha, Restorative, and PainCare Yoga, Carly brings a deeply informed, whole-person approach to her teaching. She’s spent years diving into Classical Pilates, science of pain, anatomy, breathwork, and meditation—blending it all into classes that are as much about healing and awareness as they are about strength and control. Carly’s work is rooted in the belief that quality movement and breath leads to quality of life, and she’s passionate about guiding people to move with curiosity and confidence.

Students can expect a strong and challenging practice that highlight the 6 principles of Pilates: Flow, Control, Centering, Breath, Concentration, and Precision.
instructors.name: Carly Russell

instructors.bio:
Having studied in the birth place of yoga, India- my classes integrate traditional foundations of physical asana, pranayama (breath work), yoga philosophy and mantra (chanting) meditation with a present day approach to philosophy and practice that provides students with a whole and integrative experience.

Yoga has strengthened my connection to self by finding a balanced practice of patient discipline and experiencing playfulness through the union of breath and movement. Traditional philosophy, mythology and mantra are the heart of my practice. These practices provide wisdom that connect me to my ancestral roots and our innate expansive capacity. It is with this passion for the ‘yuj’ (union) of all parts of what the practice truly provides that I share with my students.
instructors.name: Aaliya Noorani

instructors.bio:
I am a teacher, teacher trainer, manager and retreat leader with a 500hr E-RYT designation. In my classes students can expect passionate and fun instruction and a balance of structure and freedom. My yoga journey has led me from a devastating spinal and head injury to a life of vibrant health and joy. I have studied and taught in big cities, small towns, forests, beaches, jungles, sanctuaries and retreats with thousands of students. I have heard countless incredible stories of personal transformation through yoga, movement, mindfulness and meditation.

I am inspired to share powerful tools, techniques and practices with my fellow practitioners. I hope to see you on the mat!
instructors.name: Alex Atherton

instructors.bio: Coming from an extensive dance background, yoga has always been a supplemental practice for me for over a decade. I specifically gravitated towards the hot and power styles of yoga because of the challenge that resonates with me. I have been a professional dancer for the past 15 years and currently branching into the choreography and acting world. I’m grateful to have chosen a path which I love deeply. I have been a part of the YYOGA community for several years now and decided to do my 200-hour teacher training with YYOGA.. I’m also certified in yin and mat pilates, which I have also found a passion for. I believe in different forms of movement and how they can all connect. In my classes, I tend to bring a fun, challenging and creative practice incorporating various elements of movement that connect the students with themselves. Yoga, to me, is about self-discovery and self-development, and I aim to share that practice with my students.
instructors.name: Alexei Geronimo

instructors.bio: With a lifelong love of movement, along with the curiosity that comes from self-exploration, I started teaching in 2013 with Pilates Fusion classes and further expanded my offerings with Yoga the following year. I offer classes that are fun, challenging and nourishing to create a well-balanced practice that supports others in (re)connecting back to themselves in every moment. To practice what it means to be here and now, to be mindful and aware, while allowing room for possibility. In addition to my offerings on the mat, I am also a certified Life Coach and I hold certifications in Yoga Nidra and neuro-informed breathwork (pranayama).
instructors.name: Alison Klektau

instructors.bio:
I believe in living life with curiosity, enthusiasm, deep gratitude and tenacity.  These qualities have led me down this path of growth, transformation and self discovery.  It has been through my own journey of yoga and meditation that has brought me to this chapter of alignment and fulfilling my soul’s calling of teaching, allowing others to experience this profound shift within themselves.  Sharing the gift of cultivating a strong yoga and meditation practice fills me with joy, vitality and passion.


Working in a high stress corporate environment and engaging in physically demanding workouts at the gym, I gravitated towards the Yin practice of yoga, both in my personal practice as well as teaching.  Understanding the importance of allowing ourselves to slow down and be still,  both mentally and physically.
instructors.name: Amanda Brooks

instructors.bio: Yoga drew me in like nothing else had before. The practice connected me to myself on so many levels; I was able to tap into a new depth of subtlety – in mind, body, and breath. The physical challenge of the practice provided enough intensity to require presence, and the skillful way that my teachers were able to hold space created a collective energy that added a communal dimension to our individual explorations, efforts, and internal reckonings. It was playfulness, reverence, and discipline in just the right mix. Something clicked. I took my foundational 200 hour teacher training in 2009, and in 2014 completed my 300 hour advanced teacher training with Christine Price Clark, as well as my Yoga Outreach Trauma Sensitive Training. I explored meditation through vipassana and teachers like Rod Stryker and Adyashanti, the philosophical lineage of yoga through my studies at Simon Fraser University, bio-mechanical awareness and creative sequencing through Clara Roberts-Oss and Schuyler Grant
instructors.name: Amanda Gutmanis

instructors.bio: I am a non-binary, creative, queer-identifying human, trained in instructing trauma-sensitive Yin, Hatha, and Vinyasa Yoga. I aim to practice cultural appreciation and humbly acknowledge the roots of Yoga date back thousands of years to the Indus Valley and are traditional to cultures other than my own. The intention in my teaching is to share the life-enhancing practices of Yoga (beyond Asana) with diverse populations and offer ways to feel safe and spirited in body and mind. With a special interest in inclusive, accessible practices, my classes are for all levels of ability and experience. My teaching style emphasizes choice, self-inquiry, and exploration to foster emotional resilience, self-sovereignty, and create space for individual expansion. Everyone is welcome to come as they are and bravely meet that self with compassion and curiosity.
instructors.name: Amy Cunningham

instructors.bio: I started turning upside-down in my living room as a teenager, never realizing what I was doing was Yoga. Many years later, after being a total gym rat, I found Yoga in a small beach town in Mexico and that was that. Juggling a busy career as a performer and a family, I was in a constant state of anxiety. Yoga brought me to a place where I could cope and eventually I was able to share my discoveries as an instructor. I am grateful every day for the ability to connect with my students and explore with them.
instructors.name: Annabel Kershaw

instructors.bio:
I have always been motivated by learning tools I can use to better support others and as a qualified social worker, working with individuals, families, and communities to explore trauma and reduce inequality. I first tried yoga purely to increase my strength and flexibility, not realizing the life-enhancing journey it would lead me on. Being naturally energetic, I surprised myself with being drawn to the quiet and contemplative practices of Hatha and Yin. This increased my awareness of emotional responses within the body and led me to also train in dance and movement psychotherapy. Striving for authenticity, I completed my first yoga teacher training living with a family in a small town in India. Having yoga passed down to me as it had been passed down to them.

I am a Ghanaian-Brit based globally who has the pleasure of connecting and sharing my practices with communities all over the world.
instructors.name: Araba Adjaye

class_type.description:
Prepare to sweat! Builds strength and endurance through a challenging sequence of grounding postures with longer holds. 

May include arm balances and inversions, room is heated to 32° C
class_type.name: Power 60

instructors.bio:
I first discovered yoga in 2010. What started as a search for balance and a way to stretch my hamstrings from running quickly evolved into a deep passion. This passion led me to complete my first 200-hour training in 2012. Since then, I’ve been dedicated to teaching and sharing the transformative power of yoga.

I teach with clarity, passion, and purpose, creating classes that challenge, energize, and inspire. My approach blends strength, breath, and mindfulness, encouraging students to move with intention and discover their own potential—both on and off the mat.

Join me for a class that is sure to empower you, challenge you, and connect you to your best self.
instructors.name: Dustin Handley

class_type.description:
This slower practice of static postures emphasizes a balance of alignment, core stability, and mindful breathing techniques. 

Move through an intelligent sequence that focuses on strength, flexibility, and relaxation.
class_type.name: Hatha 60

instructors.bio:
Teaching yoga will always be my first love. Additionally, I work full time 1:1 helping women who struggle with flight anxiety feel calm, safe, and confident in the sky so they can enjoy travel again.

I experienced my first yoga class in 1997 and practiced almost daily for two years, loving how it transformed my life. I began teaching Hatha Yoga in 1999. Between 2004-2006, I traveled to India for nine months studying backbending and asana. From 2005-2008, I studied Yin Yoga with Sarah Powers and Zen Meditation with Shakti Mhi.

My Hatha classes are traditional, unhurried, and light in energy, while my Yin classes honor the original meridian-based practice. Outside of yoga, I’m a certified EFT Tapping, Emotion Code, EQ Life Coach, and Bio Energy practitioner.
instructors.name: Lara Catherine

I love the compassionate nature of yoga and how students of any level can find what they’re looking for in their practice.

class_type.name: Yin & Meditation 60

instructors.bio: Because I started practising Yoga & Ayurveda in 1996, you’ll step into an experiential guidance of traditional knowledge in my class with a touch of humour. As a practising yoga therapist, I have a curiosity for innovative yoga anatomy that is holistic so you may transform your self-awareness and notice more self-acceptance and freedom over time. As the Co-director of my yoga school, I have taught more than 10,000 hours in yoga teacher training programs. I aim to guide you toward your “inner knower,” a place of calm, resiliency, and enduring stability. I’m a student at heart and I have learned to appreciate my mistakes. Warning: If you’re in the right class, you’ll get a Vedic story.
instructors.name: Lucy St. John

class_type.description: Our signature hot style. An intelligent sequence of slow, held postures practiced in a 40° C room with an emphasis on alignment, core stability, and breathwork.
class_type.name: YHot 60

instructors.bio:
My yoga journey started in 2013 with SivanandaYoga, Ashtanga and Iyengar traditions. I decided to pursue my passion for yoga, so I attended Yoga teacher training in 2017 followed by another training in Ashtanga Assisting School in Toronto. Meanwhile, I was studying fitness and health promotion to learn more about anatomy and body movements that I could integrate into my yoga sequences and teaching.

I have learned about our body and its amazing abilities through Yoga. It taught me that transformation is a journey that should be taken slowly and mindfully. While practice and consistency is essential to make progress, being fully present in the moment is the key. It was a turning point in my life when I realized this. My passion is to design sequences of yoga asanas while considering fitness principles. In practice, I use verbal cues to focus on body alignment, gazing points and mindful breathing. Challenging yoga movements have uncovered my deep emotions which led to moments of relief.
instructors.name: Proshat Fard

instructors.bio:
I started my journey through movement as a ballet dancer at the age of four and was introduced to Yoga and Pilates along the way.  After I retired from dance my focus shifted to deepening my yoga practice and connecting more to what my body and spirit needed. That led me to completing my 200Hr hatha + Vinyasa training with Yogacara in 2015 and other trainings in YHot, Mat and Reformer Pilates followed.

In my classes, I aim to create a supportive and challenging space for exploration. I emphasize functional movement, building stability for long-term freedom in body, mind, and spirit. I value balance—challenge and rest, strength and surrender, effort and ease—and I love incorporating music to elevate the vibe! Whether you’re brand new to movement or looking to deepen your practice, I’d love to meet you where you’re at.✌️🪷

instructors.bio: My first yoga experience was in 2000 in the Ashtanga tradition. I developed a deep love for the practice which led me to take my first teacher training in 2009. I started teaching as soon as I received my teaching certification. I spent four years teaching in non traditional settings, on the downtown east side and at the Burnaby Youth Custody Centre. In 2013, I transitioned out of my full time profession to teaching yoga. YYOGA has been my home since then. You can find me teaching Power and Flow classes here and also leading 200 Hour Teacher Training programs.
instructors.name: Jasmina Egeler

instructors.bio: I am a Yoga Alliance Certified 500 Hour E-RYT with over 1000 hours of additional training in yoga and other complimentary movement modalities. I have been teaching yoga for 13 years and joined the YYOGA Education faculty as a YHot teacher trainer 3 years ago. I am also a registered Professional Counsellor and a Certified Life Coach which adds depth to my yoga classes as I emphasize self-awareness and personal agency. With clear, simple cueing I will guide you through your practice and help you find your calm, grounded centre so you can step back into the world feeling refreshed, focused and alive.
